intro: Phillyrea bolivaris, commonly known as the Bolivian Phillyrea, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the Oleaceae family, which includes olive trees and other related species. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. Phillyrea bolivaris typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its compact size and ornamental value make it a popular choice for landscaping in suitable climates.
